segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: A beautiful clearing outside of a village set by firelight as townsfolk gather in a small harvest festival, somewhat smaller than usual because war has yet again come to the countryside. It is the year 57, some 14 years before the events of our story began. Forgive the pun, but what shape is Bolaire in as we find him amongst the harvest festival?
segments.summary: 14 years before the main story, Bolaire is at a harvest festival during wartime

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: It's been difficult. I have been serving my current master. I have been serving my current master. The man who owns me is a soldier, and we are fighting for freedom, which is what I do. I'm tired, but I don't know I'm tired. It's been so many battles over the last 59 years. It's just another war.
segments.summary: Bolaire reflects on 59 years of battle as a mask serving various masters

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Amongst you, your companions, or maybe not *your companions, but somehow, the companions of the one who wears you, stand aside you in a small circle talking. They talk like this often, avoiding speaking directly to you. "Margrave, look, listen to me. If those Royce fucks come over the hill tomorrow, we're ruined. That Davinos lad cut down five of us." "I understand. We're going to act decisively when we get a chance to. They don't know we've got *it, do they?" You see, he points over to you.
segments.summary: Rebel soldiers discuss their situation, mentioning the Royce and a Davinos fighter, and reference Bolaire as a secret weapon

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Another one of the rebels looks over and says, "So, I think Castep's been wearing the mask a little bit too long. It's been all day, hasn't it? When I had to take it off, I almost shit myself. The thing, it wreaks havoc on the body. We should take it off sooner rather than later." You see that one of the soldiers, Clood, looks over at you and goes, "Mask, does Castep need to-- Is he hungry? Is he thirsty?"
segments.summary: The rebels discuss the physical toll of wearing Bolaire and one soldier addresses the mask directly

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: He is thirsty, and he would like to speak not through me for a moment. He would like a moment of freedom. I serve his will.
segments.summary: Bolaire responds that his wearer needs water and freedom

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Let's take it off." "No, not now! There could be fairies or anything else running around here trying to-- You have no idea what they could be doing. The Royce have ears in the bushes all around, and I--" You see that there is suddenly a change. The lighting changes and you see that a caravan has dropped a small wooden platform. There are lights, little torches in front of mirrors that cast the light back onto a small stage.
segments.summary: The soldiers debate removing the mask when a theatrical performance begins

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see entering the stage, a face done in white makeup, a little beauty mark, and the most glorious, beautiful red wig you've ever seen. Cascading curls comes down. "Hark and behold, villagers and townsfolk, for the tale we tell is of a tale of lost glory. Hearken and hear the story of the Shapers' War! Tales you have heard, blades of iron, staves of night, a single arrow striking down the last of the false and wicked Shapers. But there is one tale yet untold, the mystery of the Trickster's fall. No weapon ever seen that could find the heart true of she who walked in shadow. And yet the tale has come to us!"
segments.summary: A theatrical performer announces a play about the Shapers' War and the Trickster's fall

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Blowing some powder into a torch, (whooshing) blue fire crackles up, and the townsfolk clap and cheer. What does Bolaire do in this moment?
segments.summary: The performer creates blue fire effects and the crowd reacts with enthusiasm

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: I panic. It's a theater. It's a stage. It's the first one I've seen since-- It's the first one I've seen since my siblings and I wrote a Trickster goddess out of reality and proved to her that she cannot exist. Stages are for murder. Stages are for truth. It's the only truth. All men, all mortals lie. What is this lie? No one knows what we did. What is this?
segments.summary: Bolaire panics upon seeing theater, remembering when he and his siblings eliminated the Trickster goddess through performance

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: The last time you saw a stage was opening night and closing night of the greatest performance that Aramán has ever known. And yet it was not a play written for people. You see the announcer speaks, gesturing and says, "Behold here in her domain, Rauwyn the Trickster, shaper of men's fates and fortune who gives ill luck to the pure of heart!" "Boo, boo!" shouts the crowd.
segments.summary: Brennan references Bolaire's last theatrical experience while the play introduces Rauwyn the Trickster to crowd disapproval

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Boo.
segments.summary: Bolaire joins in booing the Trickster character

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "There is one." (laughs) "There is one weakness. For indeed, the story of how she was bested, however could a god be slain unless that god be made mortal? And why would a god abandon godhood for anything less than true love?" "(cheering)" You see, "Behold the heroic Clyneheld, romantic knight of chivalry and derring-do with a heart as large as his courage. Oho! Clyneheld!"
segments.summary: The announcer introduces the story's premise of a god becoming mortal for love and presents the hero Clyneheld

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see, galloping on a little wooden hobby horse that is quickly removed, a man takes the stage. "What ho! A knight am I. Search for lady love and yet curséd by cruel witchcraft to never know the tender caress of a maiden born under star and moon nor gleaming sun. Yes, curséd am I." You see the woman playing the Trickster turns and says, "What's this I behold? A man. I shall curse his fate, as is my wont. But what is this? How fair his visage, how glorious his temperament. Hmm, perhaps three tricks I shall play this evening on him and shall he best them, my heart he shall win!" "(cheering) Yay, yay, whoo-hoo-hoo-hoo!"
segments.summary: Clyneheld enters cursed and seeking love, while the Trickster decides to test him with three tricks

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: The announcer says, "And yea, verily did the Trickster plot her three wicked tricks and they-- What's this? A fool with a dog?" You see that a fool comes on stage and starts to chase a dog around the stage that appears to have no bearing on what is happening with the Trickster goddess.
segments.summary: Comic relief interrupts the main story as a fool chases a dog around the stage

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: (laughs)
segments.summary: Taliesin laughs at the comic relief

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see someone puts his arm around you laughing, "Oh, I love the dog! (laughs)"
segments.summary: Someone in the crowd enjoys the comic relief and puts their arm around Bolaire

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: (laughs)
segments.summary: Taliesin continues laughing

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You are grabbed and pulled back by one of the soldiers. "What are you doing?"
segments.summary: A soldier pulls Bolaire away from the crowd interaction

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: It's a very good play.
segments.summary: Bolaire expresses enjoyment of the performance

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "What do you mean it's a very-- You're a fucking weapon!"
segments.summary: The soldier reminds Bolaire harshly of his nature as a weapon

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: No, he's enjoying it so much. I was just letting-- I was letting him through. He seems to want to watch.
segments.summary: Bolaire explains he was allowing his wearer to enjoy the performance

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "What does it mean if the mask is watching the play? Is that it's a good play? It's supposed to just be-- I don't like it. Magic masks should just give you the fucking spells, not have a whole fucking personality!" And another one of them says, "I don't like this, making Castep watch the play. We should take the mask off and put it away." And you see that they say, "All right, we'll take the mask off if we need to. Let's go get the box."
segments.summary: The soldiers are disturbed by the mask having personality and decide to remove it

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: And you see that the play turns as you look up. You see the fool with the dog walks off, and the Trickster comes and says, "Trick the first have I concocted, a devilish maze of thorns guarded by fearsome ogre. And yet, at the center of the maze, a great treasure, a sword that can slay any man. We shall see what Clyneheld does here in this place to take the blade for his own, that he be the most fell knight in all of Aramán!"
segments.summary: The play continues with the Trickster's first challenge: a maze with an ogre guarding a powerful sword

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see that Clyneheld approaches the ogre and says, "Poor beast, you seem injuréd. Why do you stay in--" And they begin to say, and you see that the soldiers are coming up with the box for you.
segments.summary: Clyneheld shows compassion to the ogre while soldiers approach with a box to contain Bolaire

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: I, out of the corner of my eye, I see them coming and I reach up and I turn away from them. I see them coming and I reach up and I turn away from them.
segments.summary: Bolaire notices the soldiers approaching and turns away from them

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: And I cast Mask of Many Faces for the first time. And I create the face of the man wearing me. And I create the face of the man wearing me. And I mime putting the mask into my jacket pocket and look up.
segments.summary: Bolaire uses magic to disguise himself as his wearer and pretends to pocket the mask

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Castep, you all right?"
segments.summary: A soldier checks on who they think is Castep

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Yeah, it was-- It was so odd.
segments.summary: Bolaire responds as if he were Castep

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "You got the mask off on your own."
segments.summary: The soldier observes that the mask was apparently removed

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: It was-- It was like it was afraid, too. It was worried about what it was going to become, and it let me put it to sleep.
segments.summary: Bolaire fabricates a story about the mask being afraid and letting itself be put away

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Go ahead and give me a deception check.
segments.summary: Brennan calls for a deception roll

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: Yeah. Ugh, a 12. Oh no, wait. 12.
segments.summary: Taliesin rolls a 12 for deception

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I'll roll in front of the board. These guys only add a plus one. Four plus one is five. He looks and says, "All right, good. I'm just worried about it. Look, we need to speak, okay? Let's go ahead, and here, we're going to go set up the tent. We'll circle back up in a second. Come join us in five minutes, all right? Get some rest. You need to use the loo or anything else like that?"
segments.summary: Brennan rolls for the soldiers and they fail to see through the deception, asking Bolaire to join them soon

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: I actually, I'll join up in a little longer. I think I need food.
segments.summary: Bolaire requests more time, claiming to need food

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Oh yeah. All right. You've been wearing that thing all day. Good on you, Castep." You see he slaps you on the shoulder.
segments.summary: The soldier shows sympathy for wearing the mask all day and gives an encouraging pat

segments.speaker: Bolaire Lathalia (Taliesin Jaffe)
segments.content: I think that I'm going to have to go one at a time, very quietly and put them to sleep and tell them just to remain so that I can slit their throats and burn the evidence. Then, after that's done, the story can begin.
segments.summary: Bolaire concludes his dark plan

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: (laughs) Bolaire's story did indeed begin. And we return to the story occurring elsewhere in Aramán at a time some years later on tonight's episode of Critical Role.
segments.summary: Brennan transitions from Bolaire's story to the current timeline

segments.content: I won't. You're not allowed to say the F-word in the first 30 seconds of the stream. Oh wait, this is like 10, 15 minutes in, we're good. Hi.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: When you're traveling, your internet behavior changes. You may connect to random wifi hotspots or try to access content from your home country. Each of those moments creates a small window of risk, but using a VPN while traveling can help avoid it. And speaking of traveling, folks have been asking us, "Where is Travis during Announcement Playhouse? Is he out of town? Is he too busy? Is he just lazy?" The answer is, I don't really know. But rather than ask Laura--

segments.content: Yeah, no, it's just this gift is for a very special person and it means a lot that they receive it soon. So if you could please send. [tape pausing]

segments.content: The recipient? It's Travis Willingham. Yeah, he's a close personal friend. The note should say, "Dear Travis, you're doing great as CEO. Everyone believes in you. They trust you, they love you. You're not an idiot. You're just not."

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hello and welcome back to tonight's episode of Critical Role. We return to the Seekers Table. Matt said, "Bob Law's Law Blog."
segments.summary: Brennan welcomes back to the episode

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You guys have to not laugh as continuously into the episode because then I feel like I need to address it.
segments.summary: Brennan addresses the table's laughter

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I feel like we did such a good job.
segments.summary: Aabria comments on their behavior

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: We return to the city of Riesingürtle at the far west of the country of Helvar. This is the sister city to Dol-Makjar across the Dvalmar Pass into the lands of the old, fallen Obridimian Empire. We found our adventurers here, on their way east pursuing a vision, a vision of death and what transpires, perhaps even in realms beyond this one, a vision of deep and hidden, dark and sunken places and of the beloved ones we may know who may be there if these visions are of things that have occurred or of things that maybe have yet to.
segments.summary: Brennan sets the scene in Riesingürtle and explains the party's quest

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: More practically or perhaps tangibly, you have been moved here by the Stone of Nightsong, an artifact of ancient elven significance held by Vaelus, pursuing the first undead she has seen that seems to have something, if not exactly something like a soul, still in its control.
segments.summary: Brennan explains the Stone of Nightsong and their pursuit

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: We head east as well looking for answers, safety of what has befallen the houses of Royce and Davinos after the massacre by the treacherous House Tachonis.
segments.summary: Brennan explains their eastward journey and House conflicts

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Your adventure brought you east through the Dvalmar, arriving in the clifftop city of Riesingürtle, the Giants' Belt, where House Einfasen holds sway, a house sundered, but still holding to its ancestral seat. Night has begun to fall here after your endeavors.
segments.summary: Brennan describes arrival in Riesingürtle and House Einfasen

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Running across the demonic sisters of Tyranny at this point somewhere in southern Timmony. Also coming across the actual noble House of Einfasen, the gentle and kind-hearted seeming young lady, Ingrid, and her father, the less demure shall we say, Lord Otto Einfasen.
segments.summary: Brennan recaps encounters with Tyranny and House Einfasen

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Collected by knights, very eager to have you come stay under their protection, we return to Castle Klippenblicke where you find yourself-- Where you find yourself in the courtyard, the sun setting as Lord Einfasen approaches.
segments.summary: Brennan describes returning to Castle Klippenblicke

segments.speaker: Lord Otto Einfasen (DM)
segments.content: My Lady Royce, a pleasure once again to hold your great and noble house here in Castle Klippenblicke.
segments.summary: Lord Einfasen greets Lady Royce

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: He gives a small bow, she puts out a hand, he kisses her hand, he says,
segments.summary: Formal greeting between Lord Einfasen and Lady Royce

segments.speaker: Lord Otto Einfasen (DM)
segments.content: Your vassal servant, Sir Julien Davinos, let me know that trial and tribulation has seen you brought here under the arches of my family's ancestral home. While you are within my walls, you have my solemn word that no harm shall befall you. I also understand that many of your men-at-arms have been falsely imprisoned by my house. This matter should be resolved at once.
segments.summary: Lord Einfasen offers protection and addresses imprisoned men-at-arms

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: He turns to regard the rest of you seeing the hireling here in your service and says,
segments.summary: Lord Einfasen turns attention to the rest of the party

segments.speaker: Lord Otto Einfasen (DM)
segments.content: My Lady, I do not have the honor of your station, but I believe that you walk the Old Path.
segments.summary: Lord Einfasen addresses Thaisha about the Old Path

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I do. Thaisha Lloy.
segments.summary: Thaisha introduces herself and confirms she follows the Old Path

segments.speaker: Lord Otto Einfasen (DM)
segments.content: Thaisha Lloy?
segments.summary: Lord Einfasen repeats her name

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yes.
segments.summary: Thaisha confirms

segments.speaker: Lord Otto Einfasen (DM)
segments.content: You are very welcome here. Castle Klippenblicke has known the proud footfalls of the Lloys in the past to have another instance of that heroic family is a welcome honor.
segments.summary: Lord Einfasen welcomes Thaisha and praises the Lloy family

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: It's an honor to be here.
segments.summary: Thaisha expresses gratitude

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She says, "Lord Einfasen, I--" and he turns and says, "My Lady Royce, is there anything that you--" and she says, "I think it wise that we speak sooner rather than later. A bath is not at the height of my attention right now. I would love to take private audience with you, if I can." He says, "Very well, let's do this at once." She walks off. Anyone who wants to can give me a insight check.
segments.summary: Aranessa requests an immediate private audience with Lord Einfasen

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Ooh, I'll take that. 18.
segments.summary: Occtis rolls insight

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: On an 18, Aranessa's movement to the Lord Einfasen is a little bit-- There's not anything urgent that she needs to talk to him about. So you wonder, you know, I mean, everything's urgent, but the difference between a couple of minutes, I think you see on that 18 insight, she was reacting to him going and speaking to his ministers. I think you realized that she wants to speak to him with as little preparation on his part as possible. The rest of you are left here in the courtyard.
segments.summary: Occtis realizes Aranessa wants to speak to Lord Einfasen before he can prepare with his ministers

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Well, what do you want to do?
segments.summary: Thaisha asks what the group wants to do

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Well, I don't need to sleep.
segments.summary: Vaelus mentions not needing sleep

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: You don't have to keep saying that, but okay.
segments.summary: Thaisha responds to Vaelus about sleep

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I would like to go. Maybe we could get some of your supplies for the rest of our trip. I don't--
segments.summary: Vaelus suggests getting supplies for their trip

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I mean, as far as I'm aware, we're confined to that keep, correct?
segments.summary: Occtis asks about being confined to the keep

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Mm-hmm.
segments.summary: Thaisha confirms they are confined

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Looking around, there are soldiers around us, correct?
segments.summary: Occtis asks about soldiers around them

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I just point up, like-- (chuckles)
segments.summary: Aabria points upward indicating soldiers above

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You are not being forcefully guarded here in the courtyard. The parapets have loyal soldiers of House Einfasen accompanying them. You can see that there are a number of towers that have torch light wavering on them. Some have these enormous 10-foot diameter coal braziers just roaring with fire, roaring up into the sunlit or the sunset skyline. There are also, on the central keeps, some towers that have ballistae, that are some of the crossbow held at these ballistae are wider than 20 feet wide that are enormous, just, you know, tree trunk throwing, weapons of war out and about.
segments.summary: Description of the keep's defenses and security measures

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Here's the thing, I can only keep this form up for a little while longer. So we need to at least get somewhere where I can be in some semblance of privacy relatively soon.
segments.summary: Occtis explains his disguise magic is running out and needs privacy

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Mm-hmm.
segments.summary: Thaisha acknowledges

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: And after that I'll have to figure out a different plan.
segments.summary: Occtis needs to plan for after his disguise ends

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Okay. Well, if you want to make a case to go, I just don't know how effective asking to go investigate those carriages will be right now, especially without Aranessa and--
segments.summary: Thaisha discusses the difficulty of investigating without their leaders

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: And Julien.
segments.summary: Occtis mentions Julien's absence

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: -- Julien.
segments.summary: Thaisha agrees about Julien

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Should we go with her?
segments.summary: Vaelus asks if they should follow Aranessa

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: No.
segments.summary: Thaisha says no

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: She's okay?
segments.summary: Vaelus asks if Aranessa is okay

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: She's fine. I think she's--
segments.summary: Thaisha reassures about Aranessa

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: If she's not, I don't think we could stop it.
segments.summary: Occtis points out they couldn't help if something was wrong

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yeah.
segments.summary: Thaisha agrees

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Okay.
segments.summary: Vaelus accepts

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: At least I can't.
segments.summary: Occtis clarifies he couldn't help

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Should we hide you in a room?
segments.summary: Vaelus suggests hiding Occtis in a room

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I guess.
segments.summary: Occtis agrees to hiding

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Why don't we go take a tour of our apartments.
segments.summary: Thaisha suggests touring their quarters

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Mm-hmm.
segments.summary: Occtis agrees

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: We can give the hireling a break, and then figure out what we want to do next.
segments.summary: Thaisha suggests giving the hireling a break and planning next steps

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Great. Great.
segments.summary: Vaelus agrees enthusiastically

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Did Julien already take off?
segments.summary: Thaisha asks if Julien left

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: You know, I'll say Julien has been a little bit off the side currently, like pulled from-- Actually, since he gave you his belongings, he pulls a quill and a piece of parchment from it and over your shoulder, while you guys having this conversation, is writing out a small letter of these then rolling up, and by the time this conversation comes to an end, as he's finishing rolling it up to be delivered he goes: We should figure out which chambers are ours individually and make ourselves comfortable when we need to leave, which should be as early as we are interested in the morning. Aranessa and I should be able to emphasize the importance of us not staying here.
segments.summary: Julien writes a letter while talking about leaving early in the morning

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: That is-- I agree.
segments.summary: Occtis agrees with Julien

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: You should hide in your chambers as soon as possible.
segments.summary: Julien advises Occtis to hide quickly

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: You should perhaps consider that sending off a message while your benefactor doesn't trust you very much might be a bit of a bad look.
segments.summary: Thaisha warns Julien about sending a message when not trusted

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: I think if I was not to be trusted, I wouldn't have given him this information to begin with, and if he was not to be trusted, we would already be dead. I do not have the time to allow myself to be so--
segments.summary: Julien defends his trustworthiness and urgency

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Accommodating?
segments.summary: Thaisha supplies a word

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: -- frozen out of not wishing to make a choice.
segments.summary: Julien finishes his thought about not being paralyzed by indecision

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Sure. Go ahead, send your little message.
segments.summary: Thaisha dismissively allows Julien to send his message

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: Julien cracks his neck and steps off into the keep where he can probably quickly ascertain where the-- Not aviary, what's the chamber for--
segments.summary: Julien heads to find the message sending location

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Aerie?
segments.summary: Brennan suggests the word aerie

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: Yeah, I think it is aerie. Yeah.
segments.summary: Matt confirms aerie

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I wonder if it ever caught that bird.
segments.summary: Occtis wonders about his vulture

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: The what?
segments.summary: Thaisha asks for clarification

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: This homing pigeon is in its own version of "It Follows."

segments.speaker: Alexander (Occtis)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I smell a spinoff.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I don't know what I fucking did, man. I don't know what I fucking did. I'm way faster than this thing, but it doesn't need to eat, it doesn't need to sleep.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: This is like the snail thing.

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: Quick, somebody teleport me!

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: What am I supposed to do?

segments.speaker: Alexander (Occtis)
segments.content: It shows up outside my nest.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Incredible. Julien, as you head off, you see Aranessa walking off with Lord Einfasen. Give me a history check with advantage. It's just a difficulty of 10.
segments.summary: DM asks Julien for a history check as he observes Aranessa with Lord Einfasen

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: Oh, first roll is a natural 19.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Let's go.

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: And a natural 20!

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Let's go!

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hey! Julien, you've sent messages from this castle before. Riesingürtle is a necessary stop on the main highway to Dol-Makjar. You've been coming here, you've been coming to this castle since you were a kid, right. I think that you, actually, it depends on the mood Julien's in, but I'll say on a nat 20, you actually don't need anyone's help to go send a message.
segments.summary: DM explains Julien's familiarity with Riesingürtle Castle and that he can send messages independently

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: I don't ask for anyone's help. I send it immediately, knowing that Lady Aranessa is already mid-conversation with Lord Einfasen. So I will send that off, hoping to hear or see any response from the Golden Orchard.
segments.summary: Julien decides to send his message independently to the Golden Orchard

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As you start walking out of the courtyard, as you begin to walk out of the courtyard, go ahead and give me perception and you can do it with advantage because of that nat 20.
segments.summary: DM asks for a perception check as Julien leaves the courtyard

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: All right. Okay, that'd be 14.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: One of the knights falls in behind you at a respectful distance, about 20 feet behind you. As you begin to walk into the keep, keeps in lockstep at that distance behind you as you begin going up into the keep. You observe on the first moment that you are not headed either to pursue Lady Aranessa or to follow your friends to Schneffenkeep, you see that the knight behind you says, "My Lord Davinos."
segments.summary: A knight begins following Julien and addresses him when he doesn't head toward Aranessa or Schneffenkeep

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: Yes?
segments.summary: Julien responds to the knight

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "I regret to ask, but it is the order of my Lord Einfasen that for your own safety you remit your wanderings to the Schneffenkeep."
segments.summary: The knight informs Julien he must stay in Schneffenkeep by Lord Einfasen's orders

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: If that is the case, then I would greatly request that this message be sent to the Golden Orchard on the behalf of my Lady Aranessa and myself so as to inquire as to the safety of our families. If you do not believe me, you are welcome to read this before sending it.
segments.summary: Julien requests the knight send his message to Golden Orchard and offers to let him read it

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: He takes the note from you and says, "It will be delivered at once." You see that he walks off with it. Give me an insight check if you'd be so kind.
segments.summary: The knight takes Julien's note and promises delivery, DM asks for insight check

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: That's going to be a-- That's going to be a 12.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: 12. Got you. You see that he turns and begins to walk off. He is not taking the most direct route to the aviary.
segments.summary: Julien notices the knight is not going directly to the aviary

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: I'm going to follow behind him to see where he's going, preferably without him noticing my presence.
segments.summary: Julien decides to stealthily follow the knight

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Give me a stealth check.
segments.summary: DM requests stealth check for Julien following the knight

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Let's go.

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: That is going to be--

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Is Pass Without Trace still up?

segments.speaker: Alexander (Occtis)
segments.content: Probably not at this point.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: No.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Okay, you didn't need it.

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: Oh wait. Is it-- 22, sorry.

segments.speaker: Alexander (Occtis)
segments.content: Oh, well--

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Now you needed it.

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: I know, I know.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You fall in pretty effortlessly behind him, and again, this is the exact kind of place that you've been sneaking around your whole life in castles like this. Again, one of the benefits of being unarmored in a castle filled with armor, the slightest movement-- It is a extravagant show of wealth how many soldiers here are wearing plate armor. An unnecessary amount of soldiers are decked out in this extravagant full dress armor that even in, you know, the battalions of Royce soldiers, for most Royce soldiers, you know, for a lot of reasons, some cultural, some military, that level of armor is a liability, and over here, you think it must be as well, but it's just done for show, right? There's incredible artistry put into all of it. So this guy is clanking down the hallway. You could be walking. You could be eating an apple and this guy wouldn't hear you, right? He's his own, he's like a guy traveling with a bunch of pots clanging around on him.
segments.summary: Julien successfully follows the knight, noting the excessive display of plate armor in the castle

segments.speaker: Alexander (Occtis)
segments.content: Everyone's walking around like a one-man band?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yeah, exactly.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Taking off down the hallway, you see him walk into the central keep, and hiding behind a colonnade, you see that there is a spiral staircase. This is one of many spiral staircases within the central keep that are enormous to the point of incredulity. This spiral staircase connects up one of the central corners of the keep and is about 20 feet wide, which means that the tower is 40-foot diameter and it shoots up the side of the tower, these vaulting ceilings and this spiral staircase. Hugging to the colonnade, you see this one has a, the central column has this beautiful bas-relief of Einfasen warriors climbing up a mountainside spiraling up the staircase with it.
segments.summary: Julien follows the knight to a massive spiral staircase decorated with Einfasen warrior reliefs

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You look and see this guard approach a central set of doors, narrow double doors. The doorway's only about four feet wide, but it's about 12 feet tall, and you see that they open up. Beautiful renderings of some kind of pine forest on the outside. As he knocks on it, there's a momentary pause. The door opens up and you get a little brief view of a set of rich gold and purple drapes behind it. This door must be hidden behind some curtains in another room, but as the curtains move to the side, you see that one of the head ministers leans out to speak to this knight.
segments.summary: The knight approaches ornate doors decorated with pine forest scenes, revealing a minister behind gold and purple drapes

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You can see past him a little glance of a fireplace and you can hear Aranessa's voice in that room speaking to Lord Einfasen. As the soldier is standing there, you see that he's explaining something briefly. They're also speaking in Helvanic, a local regional language, and you see that the minister holds out his hand. The note is passed off to the minister. The minister opens it, reads it, and folds it, retying it, and holds up a hand like this in a gesture of wait, and does not return the note. Walks back inside and the knight waits at the door as the door closes.
segments.summary: Julien sees his note intercepted by the minister who reads it and keeps it while speaking to Lord Einfasen and Aranessa

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: I wait to see if, just keeping to the shadow as best I can, arms crossed, cloak obscuring as much of myself as possible, and just wait as well.
segments.summary: Julien conceals himself and waits to observe what happens

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You wait for a good-- So the question I would ask is, what sort of patience does Julien have in this moment?
segments.summary: DM asks about Julien's patience level

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Huh. Yeah, how patient is Julien?

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: I think... I think he gives it a good 30 minutes.
segments.summary: Julien decides to wait 30 minutes

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Great. You wait for 30 minutes watching this knight stand at the door and-- nothing changes.
segments.summary: After 30 minutes of waiting, the situation remains unchanged

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Oh my god.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You-- The candlelight casts a long shadow behind you. But instead of beholding the shadow behind you, your mind wanders into memory. Long days on the road were so exhausting that your head would hit the pillow of these roadside inns traveling across the Dvalmar and you would be so dehydrated, exhausted, and tired that sleep would come for you quickly. Having had this day in the city without hard travel, I think you have the energy for your mind to wander back to the palazzo, to a hand appearing inside your father's face. The smell of death. You were strong enough to survive that blast, and everyone in that palace fell to the ground, dead. As you write this letter, you realize your mother will not have been able to know what has happened to her husband.
segments.summary: Brennan describes Julien's memories as he writes his letter, recalling the palazzo incident and his father's death

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: I would wish to tell her in person, so I do not, I do not include that within the letter.
segments.summary: Julien decides not to tell his mother about his father's death in the letter

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: The aviary keeper looks up and says, "Very well, my lord. Do you have a seal?"
segments.summary: The aviary keeper asks Julien for a seal for the letter

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: Pull out a small Davinos seal and a bit of a wax, a rectangular bar, keep it at the nearest candle that's there and able to press it.
segments.summary: Julien produces his family seal and wax to seal the letter

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: He holds the candle up for you to create your seal, dripping the wax on the letter. As you do it, you see he turns around, his eyes water a little bit, looking behind you as he goes, "Freya?" And he holds the candle up and he goes, "Oh, (chuckles) so sorry. (chuckles) Sorry. Nothing." And puts the candle down, takes the missive from you and says, "To the Golden Orchard, yes? In Telmora?"
segments.summary: The aviary keeper helps Julien seal the letter but becomes distracted, possibly seeing something behind Julien

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: Yes.
segments.summary: Julien confirms the destination

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "I will send it first thing in the morning, my lord."
segments.summary: The aviary keeper promises to send the letter in the morning

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: I appreciate that. My hand relaxes from the hilt of my rapier beneath my cloak as I relax faintly.
segments.summary: Julien thanks the keeper and relaxes, his hand moving away from his weapon

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Let's go.
segments.summary: Thaisha suggests they leave

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matt)
segments.content: And then head towards the recovered caravan to grab as many bottles of Davinos wine as I can and return to my chambers.
segments.summary: Julien plans to collect wine from the caravan before returning to his room

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Are we still in the baths?
segments.summary: Vaelus asks about their current location

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yes, you are in the baths.
segments.summary: Brennan confirms they are still in the baths

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I have a question. Do you leave your veil on?
segments.summary: Thaisha asks Vaelus about her veil

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I do. So I-- As I'm taking off my boots, I get completely naked minus my veil, and so I put my hair up and then get into the tubs and sit right in front of you.
segments.summary: Vaelus removes all clothes except her veil and enters the bath

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Do you mind if I ask about the manner of your veil? You can say no. I think I'm starting to work some shampoo through. I like bath so much, I live here now. (laughs)
segments.summary: Thaisha asks about Vaelus's veil while washing her hair

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: When Occtis left, if he could have blushed, he would have.
segments.summary: Alexander describes Occtis's embarrassment at leaving the baths

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: You saw left cheek on the way out, she did not care.
segments.summary: Aabria jokes about Thaisha's lack of modesty

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: All of the sisters wear one. It is a mourning veil. It's so funny, when I first met you, I didn't realize who you were until everybody started treating you with reverence when we were on the road and I realized that you are the Lloy family who created the weapons to kill the gods.
segments.summary: Vaelus explains her mourning veil and recognizes Thaisha's family legacy

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Just ours. The Pariah Blades were for Azgra, and it was only after his falling and the realization that the rest of the Shapers, so beloved their system, that someone else, some other portion of those shaped by their deities would have to become the orcs, and we were no longer going to, but they took up arms against their Shapers as well. I believe your deity fell to the Last Arrow. Yes?
segments.summary: Thaisha explains about the Pariah Blades and asks about Vaelus's deity

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Yes.
segments.summary: Vaelus confirms her deity fell to the Last Arrow

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I don't know if my family had any part in the shaping of that beyond the inspiration to free themselves from-- (sighs)
segments.summary: Thaisha wonders about her family's role in creating the Last Arrow

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I don't fault you in any way. I just thought it was funny.
segments.summary: Vaelus reassures Thaisha she holds no blame

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Those were the workings of my grandparents. My path has been made easier for the work that my family did, but--
segments.summary: Thaisha explains the actions were her grandparents' and acknowledges her inherited privilege

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I imagine.
segments.summary: Vaelus acknowledges Thaisha's situation

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: -- my work comes now. Wow. What an honor.
segments.summary: Thaisha reflects on her current responsibility and calling it an honor

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I don't know if it's honor. I think what they did was honorable and just, and I am proud of my family and my people beyond what I can say. But I don't think that honor specifically is mine. I hope to find my own, though.
segments.summary: Thaisha clarifies her relationship to her family's honor and her desire to earn her own

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I think you will.
segments.summary: Vaelus expresses confidence in Thaisha

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: What are you searching for? You have the stone.
segments.summary: Thaisha asks about Vaelus's quest and mentions the stone

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I've been searching for an answer.
segments.summary: Vaelus reveals she's searching for an answer

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: May I ask--
segments.summary: Thaisha begins to ask a question

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I feel like I-- I feel like I found a thread, something I've been trying to find and figure out for a while, and I think it all sits with Occtis.
segments.summary: Vaelus explains she's found a clue related to Occtis

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I see the way you look at him.
segments.summary: Thaisha observes how Vaelus looks at Occtis

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: He's a kid.
segments.summary: Vaelus describes Occtis as a kid

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: (chuckles) Aren't we all, compared to you? And I don't mean that with any amount of disrespect.
segments.summary: Thaisha points out Vaelus's age relative to others

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: You don't see it but there's a slight smile under the veil. I still feel very young, but time has gotten much slower. Well. (exhales)
segments.summary: Vaelus smiles beneath her veil and reflects on time's passage

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I don't want to presume what your continued presence near Occtis with the stone may be. I have suspicions and fears. I hope they are unfounded. But until any point, at which I think your questions become dangerous and we have to have a different conversation, I hope you know I will help you however I can.
segments.summary: Thaisha expresses concern about Vaelus's intentions with Occtis and the stone but offers help

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I saw you stand in front of a blade for someone that you care about. I know what you say is true. I stand up and walk out.
segments.summary: Vaelus references Thaisha's protective actions and exits the bath

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I do a little hair tuck. (laughs) She is very cute. (laughs)
segments.summary: Aabria describes Thaisha's reaction to Vaelus

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: (laughs)
segments.summary: Ashley laughs

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: This is very--
segments.summary: Brennan begins to comment

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I wiggle my ass, just a little bit.
segments.summary: Ashley describes Vaelus's playful exit

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I love this keep!
segments.summary: Aabria expresses enthusiasm for the keep

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Shake the water off.
segments.summary: Ashley describes Vaelus shaking off water

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: How is she walking in slo-mo and all I can see is ass?
segments.summary: Aabria comments humorously on the scene

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Thaisha, you stay here. You know the road that lies to the east from here, these are some of the last creature comforts you will have if your journey takes you farther east.
segments.summary: Brennan addresses Thaisha about the journey ahead and the comforts they'll soon lose

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson (Vaelus)
segments.content: But you can see through Pin's eyes.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Well, that is the result of an adaptation to the spell. Once I created Pin, I shoved him into becoming what is known as a familiar.

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson (Vaelus)
segments.content: You're so young and your brain is quite impressive.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Well, when you grow up being told that you can't do anything, you find ways to try and emulate what everybody told you you couldn't do. You know? You've seen my family. They all just know that they can do it.

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson (Vaelus)
segments.content: You seem so different from your family.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Well, that's what happens when no one talks to you your whole life. I grew up in the house. I had a tutor. But I only saw my family during events and things I had to be present for. I barely talked to my brothers and sisters. Everybody was very important and had roles and power and they birthed an eighth kid who didn't know how to do anything.

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson (Vaelus)
segments.content: But you know how to do everything.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Well, that's-- I mean, it's because of Thjazi. He's the one who got me out of the house. He came by, he would drift in circles and be in noble houses. He saw me, and he was around, and then Thimble and I became friends because she was a kid and I was a kid. Then I met him, and he saw something that I could do, and he brought me a spell book. Some notes that someone also doing wizardry had written down, asked me to see if I could figure it out. And I did.

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson (Vaelus)
segments.content: What was it?

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: It was just some basic spells. It was little cantrips and things. He makes little sparks in his hands. Things like that. But he figured out that I could figure it out. But he figured out that I could figure it out. So he convinced my family to send me to The Penteveral when I was 15.

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson (Vaelus)
segments.content: Do you know what he wanted with the stone?

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: No, he never talked to me about it. I had not talked to Pin in a long time. Not Pin, sorry. Thimble.

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson (Vaelus)
segments.content: It's okay.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I hadn't talked to her in years by the time I saw her again.

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson (Vaelus)
segments.content: Okay.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I said something to you when we first met that I didn't mean, or you took it the wrong way. It's not your fault. You said you were a member of the Sisters of Sylandri. I said: I don't know who that is.

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson (Vaelus)
segments.content: I remember that.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I know who Sylandri is. I just didn't know who your sisterhood was. I know every single god, I know all about them. I just didn't know your specific sisterhood. So I don't know, I was-- freaking out about it because I was like, oh, she took it wrong, and I don't know how to tell her that I-- Anyway, it doesn't matter.

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson (Vaelus)
segments.content: That's okay.

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson (Vaelus)
segments.content: That's really fine. I am a sister to a dead god. I don't take offense to the things people say anymore.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I'm dead, so I can't really-- It's the same thing. Sorry you saw my stomach.

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson (Vaelus)
segments.content: That's okay. I'll let you have some time alone. Bye.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Bye.

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson (Vaelus)
segments.content: I leave.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: (laughs)

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson (Vaelus)
segments.content: Still in 800 years, I haven't figured out how to say hellos or goodbyes to people. (laughter)

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: You just hang up the phone after a phone call.

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson (Vaelus)
segments.content: Yeah. Anyway.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: What the hell was that?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As you leave, either of you can give me perception or insight, depending on if you're a little bit more physical or a little more emotional in this moment.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: That's going to be 14 perception.

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson (Vaelus)
segments.content: 20 insight.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Let's go.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: On a 14 perception, looking at the Stone of Nightsong in Vaelus' hands, that stone, it's very interesting. You felt that in a moment where there was so much catastrophic, devastating violence that there can't really be said-- You've literally never put your hands on it. On a 14 perception, you look at the heft of it and the carving of it. I think that you wonder if that is made of stone.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Mm.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: On a 20 insight, Vaelus, just leaving that room in that moment, holding the Stone of Nightsong, Its heft, its warmth. You've held it many times before. You know that it was a sacred artifact of your goddess. But you are not, the Sisters of Sylandri are not researchers or archivists, they're warriors. So you've never necessarily had deep curiosity about the story of the Stone of Nightsong. It's enough to know that it's sacred. It's not your place to ask why it might be sacred or what it might mean. Everything of the goddess' means something. Someone could have told you that a single dead leaf of a fallen tree had been held once by her hand and it would've been sacred to you. But you certainly don't know its story. I think on a 20 insight, you walk out of there saying the joking thought that Vaelus has to herself, which is she's never really learned how to say hello or goodbye. You hold this thing that belonged to your goddess and you wonder how truthful it is that you've never learned to say goodbye.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: (laughs)

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: That was good.

segments.speaker: Ashley Johnson (Vaelus)
segments.content: (sighs) Ow.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I think seeing Vaelus wearing just clothes that she grabbed from here gives him an idea of being like, oh, I don't have to wear these. These look like I'm the poster boy for my family. And he changes into generic clothing and then puts the rest of his clothes in his pack.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hell yeah.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Brennan, I know I'm not a ranger, but I have to believe that bath is my favorite terrain. What do I have to do to wrestle Pin to clean him? He smells like cabbage farts and cured meat. (laughter)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I do not think it is challenging for you to bathe Pin.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I'm also not in Pin right now, so Pin knows you and is like, meh.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: (laughs)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You clean this little dead fox.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I think as you do, you hear the clinking of someone carrying multiple wine bottles into the keep.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yes.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: widens. "If that can," and he holds up your chin. "If these can, yes." He says, "If you get knocked to the ground, we're fighting in Ezir," and he holds up some sand and says, "This in the eyes every time," and he goes through--
segments.summary: Julien's father teaches him dirty fighting tactics

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: And he says, "Listen, if you throw sand in a tournament, the crowd will boo, and if you win, they will boo harder, and you will walk away a booed and living man," and he just walks through it all with you.
segments.summary: Julien's father explains tournament crowd reactions to dirty tactics

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Standing there at the dais in that third place, your purse, it's 50 gold for first place, 50 silver for second, and 50 copper for third. You look up. Your face is swollen, one of your back teeth is chipped, and as they say, "Third place winner, a purse of 50 copper, Sir Julien Davinos," you look up into the stands as this purse is held aloft and there are boos coming out because of all the dirty tricks you played, grabbing people's hair, elbow into the face.
segments.summary: Julien receives third place in the tournament, beaten and bloodied

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You look out, spraying red wine, a Rispadan Red, there is one voice in the crowd cheering. "That's my son! Third place!" He looks out, he says, "Look. Look up. Look at first place."
segments.summary: Julien's father celebrates his son's third place finish

segments.speaker: Aabria (OOC)
segments.content: At your mother.

segments.speaker: Aabria (OOC)
segments.content: Fought with one leather sandal.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You look down. His eye completely sealed with blood coursing into it from a cut brow from where the basket hilt of your rapier cut his eyebrow open is a 19 year old. You are about to turn 13.
segments.summary: The tournament winner is revealed to be much older than young Julien

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Your father, spraying this wine out over the stands, looks out and says, "This. The numbers, no." He points to your heart. He says, "Always a greater battle to fight. Always we strive for more."
segments.summary: Julien's father gives him a life lesson about perseverance

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Your father in the stands goes out and he, walking out as the crowd gathers around, helps you off the dais. Sees that you're badly hurt. He leans into the sand, picks something up, looking around, and says, "Can we please, a healer for my son?" Pats you on the back and looks down and has a chunk of your own tooth there.
segments.summary: Julien's father finds his son's broken tooth and calls for healing

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: He says, "I would like a sword forged for my son. Please set that into the pommel." Puts an arm around you as you're hobbling off. He pulls his cheek back with his mustache bristling over it and shows you a split tooth in the back and he says, "It's a good thing you've done this day, my son."
segments.summary: Julien's father commissions a sword with his son's tooth in the pommel

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You return, the rapier at your side. There is amber set into the hilt, jewels, but in a place that it's not showy, but right under the hilt, there is a little tooth capped under one of the gems. You see the wine staining underneath you. You were very young then and there weren't that many days after that one where your father had kind words to say.
segments.summary: Julien reflects on his special rapier and his father's rare kindness

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Thaisha, as you emerge from the bath, where do you head, if anywhere?

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I think if I can flag a servant to hand off the missives that I'd sent one back to Dol-Makjar to Hal, one to Dol-Rungja to my grandmother, and then a couple throughout the city. Some of it important and some of it just busywork. I'm trying to prove a point that keeping me pinned here will be more work than it's worth because I should be able to walk around.
segments.summary: Thaisha plans to send multiple letters to prove her confinement is burdensome

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: So you want to go to the aviary to write some letters?

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: No, I'm happy to stay in these quarters and run servants ragged.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Gotcha.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Because I'm supposed to stay in here, which means everyone gets to do this for me, and it's going to be quite tedious.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As you call up the first-- You get up to your quarters, you're writing some missives, the door's open and there's a knock at your door.
segments.summary: Thaisha begins writing letters when someone knocks

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Occtis?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Thaisha, it's Aranessa."

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Oh, and I shouldn't have said Occtis. Yeah, come in.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She steps inside.
segments.summary: Aranessa enters Thaisha's room

segments.speaker: Alexander (OOC)
segments.content: I'm going to die here.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: How are you?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "The Lord Einfasen would like to see you."

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: What? Sure, of course, why? Why?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "He wished to speak with you as a representative of the Circle of Ancients."

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Okay. I'm going to make sure the door is shut and try to keep low tones. Nessa, how did it go? What do you need from me?
segments.summary: Thaisha closes door for private conversation with Aranessa

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "We spoke a great deal. Julien's decision was, I think, a prudent one in this instance. Otto's a hard man to read."

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Sure, but we don't have to be nice about Julien's decision making in close quarters.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "The Tachonis work fast, and they're not the most agile liars, so it's good that we interrupted a spread of their version of events. Did you know that there was a grand gala planned at the Palazzo Davinos a night or two ago?"

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: That's right.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "And that there was a message left announcing that House Royce had found a way to return to Faerie."

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: What? Who-- Okay, okay. I'm assuming you didn't send that.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "No. What I think is interesting is I, call it an instinct, believe that Lord Einfasen doesn't believe that, and the level of confusion and disgust he had at the insinuation that that had happened leads me to believe that it was not a lie he had crafted. Does that make sense?"

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Of course, from what little I know of them, I would trust anyone else in our group to lie before I would trust any Einfasen. They don't need to. It is not a skill they've developed.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "And yet they are not without subtlety. It is simply that they don't-- My mother had an opinion of the Einfasen that she talked about wearing a velvet glove over an iron fist versus a gauntlet. And she said of the Einfasen that when your fist is made of stone, you don't wear a gauntlet at all. I don't think they play a different game than us. I just don't think that they varnish it, which means that there can be elements of what they're trying to do that are moving beyond sight. But rather than lie, they just tend to omit."

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Fair. Do you think they generated that message?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "No."

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: But who then, in your circle, would generate a message that outlandish that they might try to believe?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "When would you have cause to make an outlandish lie? When would you lie so, for lack of a better word, ostentatiously?"

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: When there's no way it can be countermanded.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Certainly."

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: If all of you were wiped out, as they intended to do, then you can say anything and be the only voice in the room. But it would've had to come from a Davinos or a Royce, no?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "What, the message in the palazzo?"

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yes.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Does the Circle of Ancients have any official stance on this matter that I should be made aware of?"
segments.summary: Lord Einfasen asks about the Circle's stance on the Royce-Tachonis conflict

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: We do not. The Circle of Ancients, especially the greater presence that was in Dol-Makjar before, pulled back and now finds themselves in Dol-Rungja. Our purview is a much wider scope than the politicking of your families, which we happily leave you to.
segments.summary: Thaisha explains the Circle has no official stance on house politics

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "That was my only question. Thank you for your time."
segments.summary: Lord Einfasen concludes his questioning of Thaisha

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Can I insight check him?
segments.summary: Aabria requests to roll insight on Lord Einfasen

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Give me an insight.
segments.summary: Brennan approves the insight check

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yeah. This motherfucker. All right, all right. 19.
segments.summary: Aabria rolls a 19 for insight

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: On a 19, you gave him an answer he was looking for and that's where we'll throw to break.
segments.summary: Brennan indicates Thaisha gave the expected answer and calls for break

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Goddamn it.
segments.summary: Aabria reacts with frustration to the insight result

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: (groans)
segments.summary: Alexander groans in response

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Welcome back to tonight's episode of Critical Role. Last we left off in the Schneffenkeep of the castle of House Einfasen. Of Schneffenkeep.
segments.summary: Brennan welcomes viewers back after break

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: What state is Julien in when Aranessa knocks on his door?
segments.summary: Brennan asks about Julien's condition when Aranessa arrives

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Oh boy. He is halfway through the bottle, so he's not destroyed, but he's certainly not sober. His face is a mess, and then just hearing the knocking originally, he sobers up five percent, sets the bottle aside, hides the gauntlet, and immediately goes to wiping his face before pausing, and then: Who is it?
segments.summary: Julien is drunk and emotional, attempting to compose himself

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Julien, it's me."
segments.summary: Aranessa identifies herself at the door

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Just a moment. Opens the door.
segments.summary: Julien opens the door for Aranessa

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She looks in. "I didn't mean to disturb you, Julien. I just wanted to check in on you. How did it fare with the letter?"
segments.summary: Aranessa asks about the letter Julien was handling

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: I have a redundancy in place as it seemed that their paranoia was sufficient to see my initial missive intercepted, so at the very least, the hope is some sort of information will make its way to our estates.
segments.summary: Julien explains he has backup plans for sending the letter

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "(huffs) Our safety cannot be guaranteed outside the walls of the castle, and so the Lord Einfasen is hoping that we stay. Has he made any motion about our men-at-arms who I believe are supposed to be being released from being held at this moment?"
segments.summary: Aranessa asks about their men-at-arms being released

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: I have not seen them released, no. I assumed that was part of your discussion. My lady, you seem concerned. How safe do you feel within these walls?
segments.summary: Julien confirms their men haven't been released and asks about safety

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "(huffs) If the Einfasen had come to the Golden Orchard, let's say young Ingrid in the company of a druid of the Old Path and an elven warrior, I probably would've commanded that she not leave on her own, so there is some sense in us not being safe to leave. However, this city does have soldiers of ours and servants who have been arrested so we could be allowed to leave with our own guard."
segments.summary: Aranessa compares their situation and suggests they should be allowed to leave with their guard

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Perhaps if we make such a request for the morning to be on our way to be with our hopefully surviving families, that could be understood and a means of getting our individuals and materials outside of their courtyard. What do you wish to do?
segments.summary: Julien suggests requesting to leave in the morning to reach their families

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Something's not right. The Einfasen were not behind this, but there's a way they're moving. The way the whole world has been moving. The way everyone looks at us, there's that thing behind their eyes. It's pity. I don't think there's a more dangerous feeling in the world."
segments.summary: Aranessa expresses unease about how people are treating them with pity

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: I'm very familiar with it. Well, if you do not feel safe, then perhaps you begin to discuss alternative ways of spending this evening. Where you go, I go, and where Occtis goes, I imagine we also go.
segments.summary: Julien agrees and pledges to stay with Aranessa and Occtis

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: If it's all right.
segments.summary: Alexander confirms Occtis wants to stay with the group

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: At this point, I would like to also knock on the door of Julien's room, which I can hear talking as I've been looking to return a bag that I am in charge of.
segments.summary: Occtis approaches to return Julien's bag

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Aranessa looks over at you. (knocks)
segments.summary: Occtis knocks on the door

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Who is it?"
segments.summary: Someone asks who is at the door

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: It's me.
segments.summary: Occtis identifies himself

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "It's your room, Julien."
segments.summary: Aranessa reminds that it's Julien's room

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Pull the door open, grab you, and pull you in.
segments.summary: Julien quickly pulls Occtis into the room

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: (gasps)
segments.summary: Occtis reacts to being pulled in

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Close it from behind. Shh.
segments.summary: Julien closes the door and signals for quiet

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Sorry, I just-- your bag.
segments.summary: Occtis tries to return Julien's bag

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Ah, thank you.
segments.summary: Julien thanks Occtis for the bag

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: You're welcome. That's it. I just wanted to-- What's going on?
segments.summary: Occtis asks what's happening

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: No, stay but a moment.
segments.summary: Julien asks Occtis to stay

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "We're discussing how safe we feel here at Castle Klippenblicke."
segments.summary: Aranessa explains they're discussing safety concerns

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Not at all?
segments.summary: Occtis questions their safety

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Safer than a worst-case scenario, but Occtis, I don't think you're very safe here."
segments.summary: Aranessa expresses concern for Occtis's safety specifically

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: No. (laughs) I'm not.
segments.summary: Occtis agrees he's not safe

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "(huffs) It all just depends on-- There are explanations for the Lord Einfasen's behavior that are innocent."
