segments.content: A Hold Person. (laughter)
segments.summary: Player commenting on spell effect

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: It's only for a minute. Should I knock him unconscious? I feel worse.
segments.summary: Player considering knocking out the stablehand

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Just pull the horses quickly (chuckles).
segments.summary: Player advising quick action

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Nah, I'm going to elbow him at the back of the head. I need more than a minute.
segments.summary: Thaisha deciding to knock out the stablehand

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Great. Bonk. (crash)
segments.summary: Sound of stablehand being knocked out

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Sorry, sorry, sorry.
segments.summary: Thaisha apologizing repeatedly

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I add two more gold.
segments.summary: Thaisha adding more gold as compensation

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: -- paralyzed, hits the deck hard on his shoulder.
segments.summary: Description of stablehand's fall

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Sorry, sorry, sorry.
segments.summary: Thaisha continuing to apologize

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Big-ass gate is short. It would be probably-- I'll put it this way, I will make you roll one time to get to the pulley gate, but you don't necessarily know how often the pulley gate is operating at night.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Right, is it up or down?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: And is it up or down right now. It would be two rolls to get to Schongarten.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Heard. Before I make this decision, can I cast through my staff Speak with Plants to ask the gate if it's up or down?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Incredible, what is the range on Speak with Plants?

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I don't know! I got so nervous, I didn't want to keep looking. I lost the ability to read.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Cool idea, cool idea.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You look it up. And I think in this moment--

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Oh, it's self.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Yes, it's your actual voice.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I think in this moment, you guys pull up on your horses at the first large crossroads as the castle walls fade behind these alpine biergarten and residential houses. This street is all those places that have the second floors are larger than the first floor-- like overhanging. And there's also lines of laundry strung up between the buildings here that allow you to get a little bit of cover from watchtowers on the castle walls. But this is your point of making a decision here. You can cast that if you get closer to the pulleys, but it's either go for the pulley gate which is close and hope to get lucky or take the riskier route to Schongarten and deal with whatever's there when you get there.
segments.summary: The group reaches a crossroads and must decide between the pulley gate or Schongarten

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: This is awful.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I know moving towards my power base is the correct call, but the closer I bring Occtis to my people, the more worried I am for him. But I need a sure bet and they don't fuck with the druids. Not right away.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Which way is closest to Castle Torch?

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Schongarten.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You're going to go to Schongarten?

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You're going to go to the druids?

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Okay. You are going to pull off. I'm going to go ahead right now and I just want to do this for fun. It was a 16 or higher on the die for the pulley to be at the city and active. 15. It would've just pulled out of the station headed down if you guys had arrived.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: There are going to be two rolls getting to Schongarten. The two rolls getting there will, I think, actually be animal handling, just to get the horses there fast enough or you could slow way down and take stealth. It's up to you, but stealth would be more rolls.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Animal handling, please.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Okay. I'm going to need two DC 15 animal handling checks.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I hate to ask, can I use Guidance?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You absolutely can.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: It's giving me roughly one extra every time. All right, all right. Oh shit, one of those is not great. 19 for one. And 15 for the other.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Unbelievable, okay. So you guys see Thaisha takes off into the city, moving away from the pulley gates. Julien, I think you recognize that you're moving away from these other areas. As you do, pulling away from them, you see a file of Einfasen knights taking off down the road behind you, right for the pulley gate.
segments.summary: The group successfully reaches Schongarten while Einfasen knights head for the pulley gate
segments.location: streets of Einfasen leading to Schongarten

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You head off into the city, rising up. As you do, you look and see massive dolmens, carved stone. You see ancient writing written by the hands of giants in these massive standing stones. You see there are several shrines here with bits of dwarven stone tablet across them from dwarven pilgrims traveling here and this enormous series of waterfalls collecting in pools around which are snow white blossoms from dark green vines. You see there is light purple that is cast even more indigo under the starlight and the glow of Ilumi's Blanket, the planetary rings. You can see as the wind blows, there are mountain heather and snapdragons that, small motes of glittering starlight come off in the night wind, these little bioluminescent flowers under the garden pull away. You look over and see resting, overlooking this central, there's a massive flat boulder with a stone circle. It's eight calendar stones, things that map the passing of seasons and you see there is an enormous, probably 12-foot long mottled gray and white spotted leopard with a series of curling ram's horns coming off that is sleeping up on a ledge overlooking this place and probably several hundred cloth pennants blowing in the night breeze.
segments.summary: Description of Schongarten druidic sanctuary with ancient stones, waterfalls, and mystical elements

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As you approach this place, you see that there is a large, beautiful wrought iron gate closed in front of it. But you see that the gate has a small brass-handled door in the gate and you can see-- Is there anyone here that speaks either Dwarven or Giant? It's actually a language that's almost in a shared dialect between the two.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I do not.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I speak Giant.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You speak Giant? In Giant is the Giant rune for "sanctuary" written on this little inset door within the larger gate and it has a small-- that rune appears in brass next to the doorknob.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I think you know where to go.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yeah, we slow down. We don't have to-- I think it's worse to be stomping through the streets. But I'll happily-- do you want to take it since you read it?

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: This is-- You do it.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Okay. Then I'll dismount from my horse. I'm going to summon Hala beside me and yeah, just reach out to the brass handle and open the door.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: This custom in sacred groves here within the mountains of Kavros in the far west of Helvar, the gate is closed to congregants and gatherers at night as the grounds are tended to by the druids who live here in residence. But as always, a door is left unlocked for those seeking sanctuary. The sanctuary door is opened and you are able to enter this place.
segments.summary: The group enters the druidic sanctuary at Schongarten

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: As you walk up the steps, you see that the leopard snores and from this central grove, you look and there are several staircases. One of them goes down into this beautiful mountain grotto with these hardy, scraggly little pine trees that grow horizontal out from a crag and then hook around to start growing upwards. There are several small cottages and you can see a small mess hall and this appears to be a druidic monastery. So there are many druids that are living here and observing their faith in this place. But as the panther growls, this leopard growls, a small candlelight comes on in a very small cottage right at that staircase of boulders going down, and you see an old dwarven man comes out.
segments.summary: Description of the druidic monastery and the appearance of an old dwarven man

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: He's got his thick braided beard all done up. The bottom of his beard, there's a small opening with a little twig poking out of it that you recognize is a birdhouse. You see that he has a shaven head, a series of tattoos that come down with giant and dwarven tattoos that follow these bands, almost like a badger's stripes. As he steps out and goes, "Oh, welcome, welcome. Please, come inside. Are you injured or is there any other reason that you seek sanctuary here?"
segments.summary: Description of the dwarven druid Mozor and his greeting

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: we will be attacked here.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: This is the last place an undead Tachonis would come. "Sanctuary" written on the gate or not.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Confidence in safety is what allowed us to be taken aback by the esteemed and legendary hospitality of the Einfasen.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Fair point.

segments.speaker: ALEXANDER
segments.content: Well, we don't know the Einfasen actually have done anything against us yet. It might just be an abundance of caution. I'm just trying to be fair to a House who might not have done anything.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: I'm sleeping with one eye open. Stay near, Lady.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Descending down this beautiful series of falling boulders to arrive at this tiny little alpine well surrounded by several humble bunkhouses, you see that there is a very fat grizzly bear sleeping under a pine tree. There's a number of owls in the branches.
segments.summary: The party arrives at the druidic sanctuary

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: (hoots)

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: (giggles)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: And within, you see that there are longhalls that have beautiful ember-filled fireplaces that are keeping it piping hot. Very, it's almost-- It's so warm that it's soporific. It makes you want to fall asleep, go in these little bunkhouses. Smells like wood smoke, and there are shelved beds in the walls and you see there are a number of druids, many of whom have dirty boots and things like that, that are sleeping here. This is the wanderers' bunk.
segments.summary: Description of the warm, comfortable longhalls and wanderers' bunks

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see there are other larger buildings. There's a large keep, beautifully made of stunning ancient mason work that is the keep of the Circle of Stone's; that is the attendant Circle of this holy place. But you also see that there are one or two other bunks that appear to have some trappings around them. Give me a religion check. Actually, give me nature or religion, whichever you prefer.
segments.summary: DM describes the larger buildings including the Circle of Stone's keep

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Let's go nature. Okay, okay. 18, for a nature check.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: 18 for nature. You see some other attendant druidic circles that are here. There is a small banner flapping by one of the bunkhouses that represents the Circle of Seasons, which is a circle that works very closely hand in hand with the Circle of Ancients in terms of healing Barrowdells, in trying to heal the world.
segments.summary: Thaisha identifies the Circle of Seasons banner

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Across the grotto, not in one of the bunkhouses, you do see a small half shield constructed of wood and bone that bears three bloody stripes on it that you recognize as being one of many symbols of the Circle of the Hunt, which is a circle that I think you've heard of, as being one of a handful of very powerful global orders of druids.
segments.summary: Description of the Circle of the Hunt symbol

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: And this is one that you heard of a couple years ago as being like: Oh, there are some druids of the Circle of the Hunt that-- it was something about when Alogar was joining the Barrowguard, there were some druids from the Circle of the Hunt that were interested in helping that endeavor. You've heard of them more recently being extremely opposed to an envoy of druids headed towards a place called The Totality, in Hargood, that they are a very grave and fearsome circle of druids.
segments.summary: Background information about the Circle of the Hunt

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Amazing. Do I see any banners of-- Do I see anything from the Circle of Ancients present there?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: There is a symbol of the Circle of Ancients in the center tree in this little circle of buildings, this grotto, that is hanging in a place of honor and prominence, but there do not appear to be any druids of Ancients in attendance here.
segments.summary: Circle of Ancients symbol present but no druids from that circle

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Okay. Then I think I'm going to go over to the tree and whatever branches are closest to it, I want to Druidcraft a little more vibrancy around it. Not to throw more focus or honor on it, but to be very clear that there is a member of the Circle of Ancients present here now.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Awesome.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Okay, I can go and have some conversations and see if I can secure us a stealthier egress from the city.

segments.speaker: ALEXANDER
segments.content: Okay. We'll find a place to be gathered together. Should stay relatively close to each other.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Agreed.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Can I get you anything? You're looking a little pale.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: I'm fine.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Mm-hmm.

segments.speaker: ASHLEY and ALEXANDER
segments.content: (snicker)

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: And I walk away.

segments.speaker: Players
segments.content: (laughter)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Thaisha, you walk away. Aranessa looks over at you, Julien.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: (laughs) Got to do it for the baby daddy.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Let's try to get some rest, I suppose."
segments.summary: Aranessa suggests they rest

segments.speaker: ALEXANDER
segments.content: You need it.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Thought I was going to get to sleep in a big beautiful bed."
segments.summary: Aranessa laments missing out on luxury accommodations

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: You and me as well. Just a terrible thing to have pulled away.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "At least we got a bath."
segments.summary: Aranessa finds a silver lining

segments.speaker: ALEXANDER
segments.content: God, my-- I'm hoping those weren't my sisters.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: You've quite the family there, Occtis. You sure you're the black sheep on this, or do you carry some of this thread of darkness within you beyond just this soft sweet boy persona you put on for all of us?

segments.speaker: ALEXANDER
segments.content: Like an apple never falls that far from a tree. I just-- if they're here, that means they were already somewhere close to the city because the bird that the handmaiden got out, my vulture did catch, but it caught where it roosted, which means the note that she sent got to wherever it was going.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: It was close.

segments.speaker: ALEXANDER
segments.content: And it was close.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Very well. So they know that we are here.

segments.speaker: ALEXANDER
segments.content: Or whatever that note said, they know.

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Have to assume they've been notified of our--

segments.speaker: ALEXANDER
segments.content: They didn't know I was there.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: Well, they will now.

segments.speaker: ALEXANDER
segments.content: Yes.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: Is there anything we need to know about your sisters? Are they looking to kill you again as well?

segments.speaker: ALEXANDER
segments.content: I don't know if they know I'm alive or what they know. Look, they're my oldest. If it is my sisters, Petra and Ryah, they're the oldest. Probably dealt with them the least out of all my siblings as they were already held on doing important work when I was born. Surprising no one, they're not kind.

segments.speaker: OOC
segments.content: next turn because people don't like it when you don't die. They're like, "No, man, we got you out, okay?"

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Oh my god, come on!

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: This is so good.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: (yelling)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: (high-pitched scream)

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Every new druid is cooler than the last druid. This is so dope.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: We love it.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: Oh my god.

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Oh no, my sisters are so scary.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Sisters are scary. Druids are scary. It's all scary. The only question I have is: Is it Thursday yet?

segments.speaker: Matthew
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yeah!

segments.speaker: Matthew
segments.content: We have the Soldiers who are chasing something down, the Schemers, which I assume are going to be just staying where they're rooted and figuring shit out, and we're the ones that just has to keep running away.

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Because we got Hot Potae-twink over here. (laughter) Golly!
